Dear Mr. Hannah:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule R 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth;
Section reduction, prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of
Description restraints.
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition,
medical condition, psychiatric condition, and personal
history, including any history of trauma, and must be done
in a manner consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was injured during a restraint.
Investigation Attempts were made to contact complainant on 08/03/2023 and
08/04/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 with no return contact.
Youth A was interviewed on 07/06/2022 with DHHS Worker 1 and
law enforcement during an unannounced face-to-face visit to the
facility. He stated he did not remember the day of the incident in
question very well. Youth A recalled being outside of the unit and
walking on the grounds of the facility, possibly between camp one
and camp two. He stated he was on a sidewalk at first that
eventually led to a trail through the woods. Youth A stated Staff 1
was with him at that point. He recalled Supervisor 1, Staff 4 and
Supervisor 2 joined Staff 1. Youth A recalled continuing to walk
away from staff, even though they had asked him to come back
inside the unit because he was upset. Youth A recalled picking up
rocks and sticks and throwing them at Staff 1. In response, Staff 1
came closer to Youth A. Youth A stated he continued to throw
rocks at Staff 1, and eventually he was put into a standing
restraint. He described this as being bent over at the waist, Staff 1
holding the back of his shoulder and right arm, and Supervisor 1
holding the back of his other shoulder and left arm. Youth A
recalled this occurring on the sidewalk. After the restraint ended
Youth A continued to throw rocks at Staff 1, and he believed that
Staff 1 said back to him that he was going to beat up Youth A. He
remembered that one of the staff members that he could not
identify were laughing at him and calling him a “bitch”. He believed
Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, Staff 1 and Staff 4 stated this. He
2

stated he was fighting the restraint and tried to kick. He stated
that he was let go by Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 after he fell to the
ground and was face down on the ground. Youth A clarified no
one had their hands on him when he was on the ground in a prone
position. Youth A recalled standing up and hitting Supervisor 2 in
the face. He stated he was restrained again outside the front door
of the building, and this is where he was bent over a garbage can.
Youth A could not remember who was in what position for this
restraint, but it mirrored the standing restraint, where he was bent
over at the waist, and his arms were held out adjacent from him.
He stated during the first restraint he had scraped his knee, and it
was bleeding after he had fallen to the ground. When asked for
details on how this occurred, Youth A stated he dropped to the
ground when they grabbed his arms because it hurt, but he did so
under his own power. He stated he made it back inside the unit
and he cleaned his knee and got Neosporin and a bandage from a
staff member that he could not remember. Youth A believed
Supervisor 1 pinched his ear and scratched his neck when he was
fighting back during the restraint. He also believed Supervisor 1
twisted his earlobe. Youth A clarified he recalled there were four
restraints in total during this incident. The first was a standing
restraint outside in the woods. The second was a restraint on the
ground outside in the woods. The third being restrained after
standing up and punching Supervisor 1 in the face. The fourth
restraint occurred after he was back at the building outside the
front door when he was bent over a garbage can. Youth A recalled
slamming a mop bucket on the ground when he was back inside.
He did not throw this at staff, from his memory. Youth A did not
believe any other youth came outside or were escalated. He
stated he went to the hospital after the incident ended and
received medical attention for his knee.
Therapist 1 was interviewed on 07/06/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced face-to-face visit to the facility. It was
confirmed that a safety plan had been put in place by the facility in
response to the allegations. This included that Staff 1 was not to
work with Youth A alone.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 and law
enforcement on 07/19/2023 during an announced face-to-face
visit at the facility. Supervisor 1 stated it was one of many
instances of Youth A being upset and walking out of the building.
Supervisor 1 stated there were other youths that were going
AWOL at the same time and he was already outside attempting to
provide line of sight for those youth. Supervisor 1 recalled
Supervisor 2, Staff 4, and another staff he could not remember,
3

were out with him attempting to find youth when he saw Youth A
walking through the gym parking lot towards him. He believed
Staff 1 was following behind Youth A for line of sight purposes.
Supervisor 1 stated he began to follow Youth A along with Staff 1
and he heard Youth A yelling back to them “Stop following me.”
Supervisor 1 recalled Staff 1 stating “I have to follow you” with his
hands up in the air. Supervisor 1 believed Staff 1 was doing this to
attempt to show a non-threatening demeanor. Supervisor 1
recalled hearing Youth A yell back “I’ll beat your ass.” Supervisor
1 recalled trying to yell to Youth A “Everyone is going back to the
site, let’s just go back.” Youth A started to slow down, and Staff 1
and Supervisor 1 caught up with him. Supervisor 1 saw Youth A
stop, turn around and try to punch Staff 1. Supervisor 1 stated
Staff 1 stepped backwards and avoided this hit and no words were
exchanged. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A then turned back
around and continued walking in the same direction he had been.
Supervisor 1 stated he was still following when Youth A started to
pick up rocks and sticks and throw them at Staff 1. Supervisor 1
believed Staff 1 was able to avoid being hit. Youth A yelled to
them “If you don’t want any cars busted up, then stop following
me.” Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A stopped again and turned
around throwing punches towards Staff 1‘s face and upper body.
Supervisor 1 believed Staff 1 was hit. Supervisor 1 and Staff 4
were able to catch up and they performed a restraint. Supervisor 1
recalled Staff 1 was on Youth A's left side and Staff 4 on his right
side and both of them had their interior hand on Youth A’s
shoulder and their outer hand holding his wrist away from Youth
A's body. Supervisor 1 believed this restraint was performed
properly. He recalled the restraint only lasted a couple of seconds
when Youth A dropped his weight and fell onto his knees on to
rocky gravel. Supervisor 1 stated he later saw a scrape on Youth
A’s knee and believed this is when it occurred. Supervisor 1
recalled Staff 1 and Staff 4 releasing their hands from Youth A
once he fell to the ground. Youth A then stood up and took more
rocks to throw them at Staff 1 and Staff 4 while he was still on his
knees. Supervisor 1 recalled hearing Youth A yell “Fuck you” and
“I’ll beat your ass.” Youth A took another stick and threw it at Staff
4. Youth A then got into Staff 4‘s face, threatening to hit him.
Supervisor 1 recalled hearing Staff 1 and Staff 4 state “Don’t hit
him” to Youth A. Supervisor 1 was also trying to tell him to relax.
Youth A grabbed a bigger piece of wood and started walking back
to the site with it. Supervisor 1 stated they all walked back to the
site together, with Supervisor 1, Staff 4, and Staff 1 following
Youth A from some feet behind him. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth
A bringing the large piece of wood to the front door but then put it
down. Supervisor 1 grabbed the piece of wood and threw it away
4

from them so it would not be involved in the situation anymore.
Youth A then went inside. Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 stayed
outside. Supervisor 1 stated he saw from outside the front door
that a chair and a wet floor sign flew by. Youth A turned around
the corner and started coming back out to the front door as
Supervisor 1 came inside. Supervisor 1 stated that he and Youth
A made physical contact and Youth A fell to the ground and then
moved to the door to go outside. Youth A was speaking but only
really using cuss words. Supervisor 1 stated he pushed the door
open and stated to Youth A “Just go outside.” Youth A stood up
and punched Supervisor 1 four times in the face while Supervisor
1 had the door open. Supervisor 1 stated he then got ready to put
Youth A into another CPI high hold as he had done previously.
Supervisor 1 recalled Staff 4 assisting with this, and it was
performed in the same manner. Supervisor 1 stated almost
immediately Youth A dropped his weight and fell to the ground
and they let him go. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A was throwing
dirt and rocks at them again. Supervisor 1 stated he attempted to
stop talking to Youth A because nothing he had said was working
and he believed Youth A would have to “come down” by himself.
Youth A got up and went back inside and Supervisor 1 and Staff 4
followed. Youth A grabbed a mop bucket handle and was
slamming it on the ground. Supervisor 2 asked Youth A to give
him the mop bucket handle, and Youth A attempted to hit
Supervisor 2 with a closed fist. Supervisor 1 recalled seeing
Supervisor 2 step back and take this hit without reacting.
Supervisor 1 stated the incident started to die down from there
from his recollection. Overall, Supervisor 1 commented at no point
were all four of the staff members in a restraint with Youth A, they
all switched in and out over the course of time. Supervisor 1
denied making any comments to Youth A about his family, nor
hearing anyone else do so, staff or youth. He also denied making
any threats to Youth A and did not believe anyone else did so
either. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A walked out of the building one
more time and proceeded to the exit of the facility grounds.
Supervisor 1 heard Youth A state “I’m gonna wait here for the
police and tell them what you did.” Supervisor 1 recalled Staff 1
also following for line of sight. Supervisor 1 stated Supervisor 3
came out and talked to Youth A. Youth A was able to calm down
and returned to the unit with Supervisor 3. Supervisor 1 stated
staff were not aggressive and did not go hands on other than the
restraints as described. He did not see anyone, nor did he have
his own hands near Youth A’s neck or ears. Supervisor 1 denied
any restraints occurred while Youth A was on the ground.
Supervisor 1 did not think Youth A’s neck got scratched, but he
thought it was possible because staff's hands are on the top of the
5

youth’s shoulders during restraint, and Youth A resisted during the
restraint. Supervisor 1 see a scratch behind Youth A right ear after
the last restraint. Youth A was sent to Caro for medical attention
on his knee, which he believed occurred from the first restraint
Supervisor 1 stated that he felt this occurred during the first
restraint because the force at which Youth A fell to the ground
when Youth A dropped his weight, causing staff to let go of him.
Supervisor 1 recalled seeing some small bleeding on Youth A's
knee. Overall, Supervisor 1 commented that he had no concerns
with Staff 1, Staff 4, or Supervisor 2, and his work with them.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 07/19/2023 during an
announced face-to-face visit to the facility with DHHS Worker 1
and law enforcement. Supervisor 2 stated he was not involved in
any of the restraints that occurred, but he witnessed them.
Supervisor 2 stated he was outside of the building and coming
inside when he saw Youth A pushing Supervisor 1 against the wall
and then they both fell towards the exit doorway. Supervisor 2
recalled seeing Youth A stand up and hit Supervisor 1. Supervisor
1 and Staff 4 placed Youth A in a standing CPI hold. Supervisor 2
described this as involving Youth A standing on his feet and
bending over at the waist with Supervisor 1 on his left and Staff 4
on his right. Both staff had their interior hand on the top of Youth
A's shoulder and their exterior hand holding Youth A's wrist away
from his body. Supervisor 2 stated as this occurred, he moved a
trash can out of the way because Youth A was resisting and could
have fallen into it. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A almost immediately
dropped to the ground and Supervisor 1 and Staff 4 released him.
Supervisor 2 stated Youth A attempted to hit them again and the
same restraint was performed with identical staff placement.
Supervisor 2 stated he did not remember how the incident evolved
after the last restraint as he might have been called to another
situation. Shortly afterwards he saw Youth A inside, and he
remembered Youth A grabbing the ringer from a mop bucket and
gesturing it threateningly towards anyone around. Supervisor 2
stated Youth A came up to hit Supervisor 2 in his chin and
shoulder. Supervisor 2 recalled saying to Youth A “I didn’t ever
touch you, why would you try to hit me?” because he recalled
Youth A saying something about Supervisor 2 putting his hands
on him. Supervisor 2 stated he did not see the first restraint earlier
because it had occurred out in the woods. He recalled there was
no pinching of ears or scratching on Youth A's neck during the
restraint he witnessed. Supervisor 2 stated he saw the injury to
Youth A's knee. Supervisor 2 stated he never heard Youth A's
family ever come up during any parts of the incident that he was
6

involved in, nor did he hear any threats from staff, or even other
youth that were around and witnessing Youth A's struggles.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 08/02/2023
during a face-to-face visit at the facility. Staff 1 stated he had just
clocked in for his shift when he was told Youth A was out in the
woods AWOL’ing. Staff 1 recalled Youth A came back inside the
unit and almost immediately ran back out the door of the unit. Staff
1 stated he followed Youth A outside. Youth A walked a great
distance with Staff 1 following him. Staff 1 recalled hearing Youth
A state “Quit following me.” Staff 1 said something back to him to
the effect of “Have I ever done anything to you?” only for Youth A
to respond, “Shut the fuck up.” Staff 1 recalled Youth A stopped
walking and quickly approached him to push him. Staff 1 stated he
took a step back. Staff 1 recalled Staff 4, Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 2 were also following. Staff 1 recalled Youth A started
to throw sticks and rocks at him and yell “Fuck you” and “I’m
gonna beat your ass.” Staff 1 stated he was far enough away to
get away from most of the rocks. Youth A grabbed a bigger rock
and sticks and charged at Staff 1 to swing it at him. Staff 1 stated
he and Staff 4 performed a standing CPI hold. Staff 1 recalled
Staff 4 was on one side, and he was on the other, and both of
their interior hands were on Youth A’s shoulder, and they were
holding Youth A's wrists away from him as the restraint is
designed. Staff 1 stated this restraint did not occur for more than a
second or two until Youth A dropped his weight and they let go.
Staff 1 believed this is when Youth A scratched his knee, and it
started bleeding. Staff 1 recalled Youth A was screaming and
continuing to threaten Staff 1 and other staff. Staff 1 recalled
Youth A stood up and walked towards the facility again. Staff 1
stated he continued to follow Youth A from a distance away. Youth
A started to throw bigger rocks, but Staff 1 was never close
enough to get hit. Staff 1 recalled Youth A going inside and
eventually grabbing a handle from a mop bucket and smashing it
on the ground and gesturing it towards Supervisor 2. He stated
he saw Youth A punch Staff 4 only to have Staff 4 put his hands
up and take a step backwards. Staff 1 recalled Youth A turned the
corner and went back out the front door where he encountered
Supervisor 1 and was eventually put in another standing restraint,
identical to what had occurred outside. Staff 1 stated he had a full
view of the incident once he made it outside. Staff 1 described a
struggle between Supervisor 1, Staff 4 and Youth A right outside
the door, because Youth A was fighting the restraint and
attempting to hit staff. Staff 1 stated he never saw Supervisor 1 hit
or shove Youth A. Staff 1 saw Youth A looked at Supervisor 1,
stood up and yelled/cussed at them. Staff 1 stated he never saw
7

anyone get near Youth A's neck or ear during any of the physical
parts of the incident. Staff 1 also stated Youth A never had his
face in the ground nor was he laying down with staff's hands on
him. Staff 1 stated the only injury of Youth A’s he noticed was his
knee bleeding.
Youth B was interviewed on 08/02/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
law enforcement during an announced face-to-face visit at the
facility. Youth B stated he saw Youth A inside when he tried to hit
Supervisor 2 and was threatening with a mop bucket handle, as
well as when Youth A went back outside and had to be restrained
by the front door. He stated he has seen Youth A run out of the
facility many times, and that, despite Youth A describing being
upset, Youth B did not believe that any staff members involved,
which he could not name specifically, ever said anything in this
instance to make him upset in the first place.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 08/02/2023. She stated she saw parts
of the incident overall, but she was not directly involved. Staff 2
stated she did not see any of the exterior parts of the incident,
other than what was occurring right outside the front door of the
building. Staff 2 stated she saw Youth A threatening Supervisor 2
with a mop bucket handle, and she was able to take this out of his
hands without incident.
During the announced face-to-face visit to the facility on
08/02/2023 Law Enforcement sated that no charges would be
filed against staff as a result of their investigation of the incident in
question.
Youth C was interviewed over video conference with DHHS
Worker 1 on 08/03/2023. Youth C stated he was walking into the
unit and came over to the common area when he heard,
screaming, and yelling. Youth C stated he saw Youth A on the
ground outside of the building by the air conditioning unit and was
sitting alone. He believed Youth A had a bloody nose and mouth.
Youth C recalled seeing Youth A start to get up with Supervisor 2
standing near him. Youth C stated he never saw staff any staff
members involved, which he could not name specifically, put their
hands on Youth A or assault Youth A from what he could recall.
Documents reviewed:
• Safety plan dated 07/06/2023 was provided and reviewed.
It stated that Staff 1 was not to work Youth A alone for the
duration of this investigation.
8

• Restraint training records for staff involved were provided
and are as follows:
o Staff 1 - CPI Disengagement skills and holding skills
-05/02/2023 and CPI Training- 4/28/2023
o Staff 4 - CPI Disengagement skills and holding skills
-05/02/2023 and CPI Training- 4/28/2023
o Supervisor 1 - CPI Non-Violent Physical
Management- 4/28/2023 and CPI Training-
04/28/2023
o Supervisor 2 - CPI Limit setting- 05/24/2023, CPI
Responding to Defensive behaviors-5/17/2023, CPI -
Non violent Physical Management- 05/09/2023, and
CPI Training- 04/28/2023
• Incident Report authored by Supervisor 1 dated
07/02/2023. It states Youth A pushed Supervisor 1 while in
the hallway heading out the front door of the
building. Supervisor 1 attempted a CPI High restraint hold
but was unsuccessful because Youth A fell in front of the
door. Youth A hit Supervisor 1 and a CPI High hold was
then used successfully until Youth A dropped his weight
and fell to the ground. Staff released.
• Incident Report authored by Staff 1 dated 7/02/2023. Youth
A left the unit and Staff 1 followed to attempt to provide line
of sight supervision. Youth A started to throw rocks and
sticks at Staff 1 and then charged at Staff 1 with a rock and
a stick. Staff 1 hugged Youth A and Staff 1 and Staff 4
were able to perform a CPI High restraint hold. Youth A
dropped his weight to the ground and staff released their
hands from him.
• Medical documentation from 07/02/2023 at 6:34 pm from
McLaren Caro Community Hospital was received and
referenced. Youth A’s knee injuries were diagnosed
without any fracture or dislocation but with
abrasions. Youth A reported knee pain and he was
ambulatory with no complications. There were no other
injuries noted for Youth A and he did not report any other
concerns to medical professionals at that time.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff, video footage and
documentation reviewed there was not sufficient evidence found
to show that injuries to Youth A were caused by inappropriate
restraint techniques performed by staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section
Description
9

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to
a youth’s background or appearance or mental state.
Yelling, threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly
prohibited.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth heard derogatory language from staff during an incident.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed on 07/06/2022 with DHHS Worker 1 and
law enforcement during an unannounced face-to-face visit to the
facility. He stated Staff 1 said “Do you want to try something?”
after Youth A had stated “I’m gonna beat you up.” He stated Staff
1 had been rude to him, and he walked away from Staff 1. He
couldn’t remember what Staff 1 said that made him so upset. He
stated he was not sure what was said about his family. He stated
he heard someone say, “Fuck your mom” and “Fuck your
grandmother and that’s why she’s dead.” He stated he has never
heard anybody say anything like that before, but repeated he
could not remember who said that.
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 were interviewed separately with
DHHS Worker 1 and law enforcement on 07/19/2023 during an
announced face-to-face visit at the facility. Both staff denied
saying anything threatening or any disparaging comments about
Youth A or about his family. They also stated they did not hear
any of these comments from Staff 1 specifically.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 08/02/2023
during a face-to-face visit at the facility. Staff 1 stated when Youth
A was picking up bigger sticks, and rocks, and throwing them or
threatening to throw them, Staff 1 stated back to Youth A “do it”
and “just do it if you’re going to.” Staff 1 were called hearing Youth
A say “what are you saying, you’re going to beat me up” and Staff
1 responded “no, just do it”. He said he only said this because he
did not think Youth A was going to continue to throw bigger and
bigger items at him. Staff 1 stated he never heard staff threaten
Youth A or call him or his family any negative names. Staff 1 also
stated he has never used disparaging language towards any
youth, about their families or threatened youth.
10

Youth B was interviewed on 08/02/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
law enforcement during an announced face-to-face visit at the
facility. Youth B stated he never heard staff talk about Youth A or
his family. Youth C did state that he has heard Staff 1 say
disparaging things to youth in the past such as “What are you,
gay” about wanting to go hang out by the river on campus. Youth
B stated he did not hear any staff threaten Youth A, but also
commented that he has heard Staff 1 say things like “if you do
that, I’ll do it right back” to another youth that he could not
remember.
Youth C was interviewed over video conference with DHHS
Worker 1 on 08/03/2023. Youth C stated he heard Staff 1 use
negative language when speaking with youth but could not offer
specifics.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff there was not sufficient
evidence found that staff used verbal abuse or derogatory
language during the incident in question.
Consultation provided:
It was discussed with Administrator 1 that even language that is
not meant to but can easily come across as challenging or
demeaning to youth can do harm to an escalated situation and
can provide unnecessary triggers. It is recommended Staff 1 be
refreshed on de-escalation techniques.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health
Description service policies and procedures addressing all of the
following:
(b) Health screening procedures
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A allegedly had seizure like symptoms during the incident
and staff did not act appropriately in response.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed on 07/06/2022 with DHHS Worker 1 and
law enforcement during an unannounced face-to-face visit to the
facility. He never stated in this interview that he suffered a seizure,
pseudo-seizure or experience any seizure like symptoms during
the incident in question.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 08/02/2023
during a face-to-face visit at the facility. Staff 1 stated at one point
Youth A had fallen to the ground and no one had their hands on
him, and Staff 1 believed Youth A faked a seizure. Staff 1
11

described this as Youth A shaking and spitting. During a follow up
phone call with Staff 1 and DHHS Worker 1 that occurred on
08/03/2023, Staff 1 stated he was not aware Youth A had any
seizure like symptoms or occurrences in the past and could not
recall if that had ever been covered in staff meetings or facility
communication.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed again over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1 on 08/09/2023. He stated he knew about the seizure
concerns with Youth A. Supervisor 1 stated he had been informed
by management at the facility that Youth A was suffering from
seizure-like symptoms during escalated incidents, but medical
professionals that had worked with Youth A were not diagnosing
them as seizures but “pseudo-seizures.” Supervisor 1 stated
usually a call to 911 goes in when Youth A shows symptoms of
this. Supervisor 1 recalled an instance when Youth A was
unresponsive with his eyes closed and was shaking. Supervisor 1
stated he did not see any similar symptoms from Youth A during
the incident in question. Supervisor 1 confirmed that he was
present during the part of the incident where Youth A was on the
ground and Staff 1 stated he witnessed seizure-like symptoms.
One reason Supervisor 1 recalled this is that Youth A was very
vocal and alert throughout the entire incident, commonly yelling
and threatening staff.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 08/11/2023. He stated he knew Youth A had seizure-like
activity and it was described to him by other staff as “pseudo-
seizures.” He recalled one time when it looked like Youth A was
sleeping and was unresponsive. Supervisor 2 stated he was the
one who made the decision to have Youth A sent to urgent care
for more medical attention during that instance. Supervisor 2
stated staff are aware of this ongoing health issue for Youth A,
and it has been talked about several times in meetings and in
shared documentation. He did not believe there would be any
issue with even third shift or part-time staff not knowing.
Supervisor 2 stated he did not see any symptoms that day.
Supervisor 2 stated Youth A was verbal and yelling the whole time
when he was engaged in brief restraints or had dropped to the
ground on his own. Supervisor 2 never saw Youth A's face touch
